      • convertVarIntByteBufferToByteArray

        public static byte[] convertVarIntByteBufferToByteArray(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Converts a variable length integer (https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Protocol_documentation#Variable_length_integer) from a ByteBuffer to byte array
        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - Bytebuffer where to read from the variable length integer
        Returns:
        byte[] of the variable length integer (including marker)

      • convertVarIntByteBufferToLong

        public static long convertVarIntByteBufferToLong(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Converts a variable length integer (https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Protocol_documentation#Variable_length_integer) from a ByteBuffer to long
        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - Bytebuffer where to read from the variable length integer
        Returns:
        long corresponding to variable length integer. Please note that it is signed long and not unsigned long as int the Bitcoin specification. Should be in practice not relevant.

      • getVarInt

        public static long getVarInt(byte[] varInt)
        Converts a variable length integer (https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Protocol_documentation#Variable_length_integer) to long
        Parameters:
        varInt - byte array containing variable length integer
        Returns:
        long corresponding to variable length integer

      • getVarIntSize

        public static byte getVarIntSize(byte firstByteVarInt)
        Determines size of a variable length integer (https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Protocol_documentation#Variable_length_integer)
        Parameters:
        firstByteVarInt - first byte of the variable integeer
        Returns:
        byte with the size of the variable int (either 2, 3, 5 or 9) - does include the marker!

      • getSize

        public static long getSize(byte[] byteSize)
        Reads a size from a reversed byte order, such as block size in the block header
        Parameters:
        byteSize - byte array with a length of exactly 4
        Returns:
        size, returns 0 in case of invalid block size

        Reverses the order of the byte array
        Parameters:
        inputByteArray - array to be reversed
        Returns:
        inputByteArray in reversed order

      • convertHexStringToByteArray

        public static byte[] convertHexStringToByteArray(java.lang.String hexString)
        Converts a Hex String to Byte Array. Only used for configuration not for parsing. Hex String is in format of xsd:hexBinary
        Parameters:
        hexString - String in Hex format.
        Returns:
        byte array corresponding to String in Hex format

      • convertByteArrayToHexString

        public static java.lang.String convertByteArrayToHexString(byte[] byteArray)
        Converts a Byte Array to Hex String. Only used for configuration not for parsing. Hex String is in format of xsd:hexBinary
        Parameters:
        byteArray - byte array to convert
        Returns:
        String in Hex format corresponding to byteArray

      • compareMagics

        public static boolean compareMagics(byte[] magic1,
                                    byte[] magic2)
        Compares two Bitcoin magics
        Parameters:
        magic1 - first magic
        magic2 - second magics
        Returns:
        false, if do not match, true if match

      • getTransactionHash

        public static byte[] getTransactionHash(BitcoinTransaction transaction)
                                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Calculates the double SHA256-Hash of a transaction in little endian format. This could be used for certain analysis scenario where one want to investigate the referenced transaction used as an input for a Transaction. Furthermore, it can be used as a unique identifier of the transaction
        Parameters:
        transaction - The BitcoinTransaction of which we want to calculate the hash
        Returns:
        byte array containing the hash of the transaction. Note: This one can be compared to a prevTransactionHash. However, if you want to search for it in popular blockchain explorers then you need to apply the function BitcoinUtil.reverseByteArray to it!
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of errors reading from the InputStream
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - in case the hashing algorithm of the Bitcoin Blockchain is not supported by the JDK

      • getBlockHash

        public static byte[] getBlockHash(BitcoinBlock block)
                           throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Calculates the double SHA256-Hash of a block in little endian format.
        Parameters:
        block - The BitcoinTransaction of which we want to calculate the hash
        Returns:
        byte array containing the hash of the block.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of errors reading from the InputStream
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - in case the hashing algorithm of the Bitcoin Blockchain is not supported by the JDK
